intro: Theobroma martii, commonly known as the West African cocoa tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. The plant produces pods containing seeds that are the primary source of cocoa butter and cocoa solids used in chocolate production. Its leaves are elliptical, dark green, and have a glossy appearance. Theobroma martii thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil.
